arts.ttl: 'Shame' - Frank Lampard provides key Coventry City injury update - CoventryLive
arts.sum: The 23-year-old suffered the injury when he threw himself at a Tatsuhiro Sakamoto cross in the seventh minute, sending a diving header past Oxford United goalkeeper Jamie Cumming to put the Sky Blues in front in a game that ended in a 3-2 away win at the Kassam Stadium. Frank Lampard confirmed Coventry City fans’ worst fears that Jack Rudoni has suffered a dislocated shoulder that could keep the goal-getting midfielder out for a while.

arts.ttl: Coventry City player ratings after 3-2 win at Oxford United
arts.sum: The Sky Blues got off to a flying start when Jack Rudoni threw himself at a seventh minute Tatsuhiro Sakamoto cross to head past goalkeeper Jamie Cumming and give the visitors the lead from what was only their second real attack at the Kassam Stadium. United, however, got themselves back on level terms in the 53rd minute when dangerman Placheta broke free down the right and pulled the ball back to Ole Romeny to slot home the equaliser from about 12 yards out, as City protested that there had been a foul in the build-up.

arts.ttl: Tatsuhiro Sakamoto secures Coventry’s win at Oxford
Haji Wright returns as Frank Lampard names his Coventry City squad to face Oxford United
arts.sum: City: Oliver Dovin; Milan van Ewijk, Bobby Thomas, Liam Kitching, Jake Bidwell; Josh Eccles, Matt Grimes, Jack Rudoni; Tatsuhiro Sakamoto, Ellis Simms, Ephron Mason-Clark. That leaves Ellis Simms to continue to lead the line with Brandon Thomas-Asante and Wright offering striking back-up.

arts.ttl: Oxford United v Coventry City live updates and team news from the Kassam Stadium
arts.sum: Get the latest Coventry City news sent straight to your phone by joining our Sky Blues WhatsApp group. Frank Lampard was boosted by the return to action of midfielder Ben Sheaf against Preston North End last time out, with the captain expected to get more match minutes at the Kassam Stadium as he continues to build up his fitness levels after recovering from a calf strain.

arts.ttl: Why former midfield maestro 'tips' his hat and Coventry City under Frank Lampard
arts.sum: Gary McAllister says he “tips his hat” to Frank Lampard for bouncing back to football management in style after leading Coventry City to within striking distance of the Championship play-offs and the mouth-watering prospect of promotion back to the Premier League . Get the latest Coventry City news sent straight to your phone by joining our Sky Blues WhatsApp group.

arts.ttl: What happened to 11 players linked with transfer interest from Coventry City in January
arts.sum: The Sun’s transfer specialist Alan Nixon claimed he could join Derby in another loan spell, while TEAMtalk reported that number of clubs have registered an interest in signing the 21-year-old, including Sheffield United, Coventry City, Middlesbrough, Queens Park Rangers and Stoke City. The January transfer window provided much excitement for Coventry City fans as the club was linked with a string of potential new signings during the mid-term trading point.

arts.ttl: Car crash setback for 'really interesting' Coventry City prospect ripping it up in League Two
arts.sum: Get the latest Coventry City news sent straight to your phone by joining our Sky Blues WhatsApp group. Frank Lampard says Coventry City striker Justin Obikwu is a “really interesting” prospect and is looking forward to getting a closer look at the loan player come the summer.

arts.ttl: Frank Lampard addresses prospect of playing Coventry City duo together for the first time
arts.sum: As for whether the duo will be given similar roles or if one will be asked to do something a little bit different, the City boss said: “I think they’ve got different qualities as midfield players and I think they can both operate in deeper parts of midfield but I think particularly with Grimesy, he really enjoys to be deep, particularly in possession, how he helps to build within the team. And they have certainly got enough different qualities about them where they can complement each other well, alongside the other midfield players that we can obviously use.”

arts.ttl: Wright, Sheaf, Torp - Coventry City injury latest as Frank Lampard weighs up Oxford United options - CoventryLive
arts.sum: Asked if it will be case of phased returns for Wright and Sheaf in terms of building up their match minutes from the bench, Lampard said: “Well we’ll see because they’re players of a level who can really help the team as well, so that’s just for me to gauge through how they look and feel in training, and how ready they are. The Sky Blues boss is also boosted by last week’s return of skipper Ben Sheaf, who was given the final six minutes from the bench to help see out the 2-1 victory over Preston North End, and the head coach is now just one senior player – Victor Torp – away from having a fully fit squad.
